posts.content: I'll give them a ring then, thanks

Hello.
I thought I'd catch up with this thread again.
Id be interested in the table top laminate and matt black, if anybody want to join in.
I've had a pm but I had a look on the ids web page but couldn't find it.
There's an IDS in Swindon 45mins/ 1 hr and I'm.sometimes down the m4 for work so posiblly could collect.

Kepp the post and thoughts coming. working as a team we could get a better deal.

Jason

sheedy wrote:Kevin, I purchased a sheet of Jet Black Shell F6468 formica from IDS Surfaces some time ago and in my opinion its a good match. I could send you an offcut if you like.
I'm also after a piece of the inner formica Grey muslin F8261 to replace the inside of my cooker unit (Devon 64 bus).

Steve

Hi Steve, cheers for the off cut, the textured surface is different to mine, on mine it's like a brushed finish. I've just ordered some sample pieces from Moorland to see if they're closer, cheers again
I think it's normally about 0.7mm thick. Some of the original facing on my cupboards is almost 2mm, just wondered if it was Bakelite?

Hi all
I need the black, inner cupboards and table top laminates
If any ones buying any I would like to join in
Or information where I can buy it from
Regards
Mark

Hi

I have some black formica spare. I need enough to make the overhead table but should have some spare still.

Cheers

Hi, could do with some for the cooker top and cupboard doors.

Thanks.

Jim

63 Split wrote:Hi

I have some black formica spare. I need enough to make the overhead table but should have some spare still.

Cheers

Would you happen to know what the product code is for the Formica you have? I've got a couple of samples coming from Formica and Egger to try and get the nearest to the original. Cheers Kevin

Hi

It was Diamond Black. Product Code F2253. Looks just like the original formica I have in the van....just need to get it scuffed up a bit, but the kids will see to that
